paragraphs.text: Cliques, groups and fiefdoms are inevitable in The Blue because where there are thoughts and a means in which to express them (even in our strictly monitored and controlled environments), hierarchies will always exist. We encourage you to not engage in flamewars only if it is to your strategic advancement. Nobody likes a troublemaker, and due to recent budget cuts most of our community managers can’t work overtime.
paragraphs.name: e900

paragraphs.text: Beautifully written. I started doing “the cyber” back in 1998 and have never seen someone capture the interplay between our human drives for acceptance and the ephemerality of online attention. I smiled at the irony as I “Liked” this.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing.

virtuals.metaDescription: In The Blue you learn quickly that you have to earn your keep. That knowledge makes your stronger even when everyone on the Outside grows soft, complacent, comfortable and weak.

6e389a82b456.title: Great story, Felicia, very reminiscent of Ray Bradbury.

paragraphs.text: Great story, Felicia, very reminiscent of Ray Bradbury. Some wonderful lines like: “ We pictured an existence free of Republicans, Christian fundamentalists, global warming, telemarketers, reality TV shows, eyeliner, stamps, parking tickets, kale, and junk mail.” The inclusion of kale is perfect. A frightening forecast, all in all, but very possible…
